title: Body Camera Footage of Alicia Moore’s Arrest and Car Fire (May 26, 2023)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all body-worn camera footage related to the May 26, 2023, incident involving Alicia Moore at the Dillard’s store in Oviedo Mall.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: May 26, 2023
Location: Dillard’s, Oviedo Mall, Oviedo, FL
Suspect: Alicia Moore (26 years old)
Incident Summary:
Moore was reportedly shoplifting inside Dillard’s for about an hour, accompanied by a male companion.
During this time, her vehicle caught fire with her children inside.
Good Samaritans rescued the children, who were covered in soot and one of whom suffered first-degree burns.
Firefighters arrived and extinguished the car fire, but the vehicle was completely destroyed.
Police and paramedics responded to the scene, and Moore was arrested for aggravated child neglect.

Requested Footage:
All body-worn camera footage from officers who:
Responded to the car fire and interacted with witnesses.
Spoke with and arrested Alicia Moore.
Recorded Moore’s reaction upon exiting Dillard’s and seeing the fire.
Interviewed the good Samaritans who rescued the children.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Body Camera Footage of Mark Roher’s Arrest (January 18, 2024)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to body-worn camera footage related to the January 18, 2024, arrest of Mark Roher at Boca Lago Country Club in Boca Raton, Florida.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: January 18, 2024
Location: Boca Lago Country Club, Boca Raton, FL
Suspect: Mark Stuart Roher (52 years old)
Incident Summary:
Roher was involved in an altercation at a wedding buffet over the prime rib carving station.
He allegedly smashed a plate over another guest’s head after an argument about children skipping the line.
A large brawl ensued, with multiple guests reportedly getting involved.
Roher claimed he was the real victim and insisted that another guest kicked him.
Bodycam footage reportedly captures Roher:
Complaining about being arrested and stating: "I want to press charges against him."
Invoking his right to remain silent but later admitting he initiated the conflict.
Telling deputies: "I don't think it's right that you're parading me in front of them."
Witnesses, including a waiter at the venue, confirmed that Roher struck the victim with a plate.
Roher was charged with aggravated battery with a deadly weapon and later released on $1,000 bond.
His next court date is scheduled for February 20, 2024.
Requested Footage:
Bodycam footage from all officers who:
Responded to the scene at Boca Lago Country Club.
Interacted with or arrested Mark Roher.
Recorded Roher’s statements regarding the incident.
Transported Roher to jail or processed him at the station.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Body Camera Footage of Amandeep Singh’s Arrest (May 3, 2023)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to all available body-worn camera footage related to the May 3, 2023, arrest of Amandeep Singh following a fatal DUI crash that killed two 14-year-old boys in Long Island, New York.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: May 3, 2023
Location: Long Island, NY
Suspect: Amandeep Singh (36 years old)
Incident Summary:
Singh was driving a Dodge Ram pickup truck the wrong way when he crashed into an Alfa Romeo carrying four teenage tennis players.
Two 14-year-old victims, Drew Hassenbein and Ethan Falkowitz, were killed on impact.
The other two teenage passengers survived with injuries.
Singh attempted to flee the scene and hid in a dumpster before being apprehended by police.

Requested Footage:
Bodycam footage from all officers who:
- Located and arrested Amandeep Singh near the dumpster.
- Conducted Singh’s initial questioning at the scene.
- Administered sobriety tests or breathalyzer.
- Transported Singh to jail or processed him at the station.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Public Records Request – Body Camera Footage of Bree Ann Gadoury’s Arrest (May 11, 2024)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting, under Florida Public Records Law, access to all available body-worn camera footage related to the May 11, 2024, arrest of Bree Ann Gadoury (42 years old) near East State Road 100 and Aviation Drive for resisting arrest and aggravated battery on a law enforcement officer.

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:
Date: May 11, 2024
Location: Near East State Road 100 and Aviation Drive, Bunnell, FL
Suspect: Bree Ann Gadoury (42 years old)
Incident Summary:
Deputies were dispatched after reports of a woman on a bicycle recklessly weaving in and out of traffic, nearly causing collisions.
Before deputies arrived, she keyed multiple vehicles.
When approached, Gadoury fled into a grassy field and actively resisted arrest.
While struggling with deputies, she attempted to stab an officer in the leg with a sharp Fix-a-Flat tool.
A Taser was deployed to subdue her.
She continued resisting by using her legs to block officers from placing her in the patrol car.
She was ultimately charged with:
Fleeing with intent to elude law enforcement
Resisting an officer with violence
Aggravated battery on a law enforcement officer
Two counts of criminal mischief
Requested Footage:
bodycam footage from responding deputies capturing:
The initial traffic stop attempt on the bicycle
The pursuit and struggle in the grassy field
The attempted stabbing with the Fix-a-Flat tool
Deployment of the Taser
Transport and resistance inside the patrol car

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Public Records Request – Body Camera Footage of Amber McCann’s Shoplifting Arrest (March 25, 2024)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this request under for access to all available body-worn camera footage related to the March 25, 2024, arrest of Amber McCann at the Palm Coast Walmart for grand theft ($750–$5,000) and drug-related charges.

To assist in locating the footage, here are key details of the incident:

- Date: March 25, 2024
- Location: Walmart, Palm Coast, Florida
- Suspect: Amber McCann (30 years old)
Incident Details:
A concerned citizen reported McCann shoplifting inside Walmart.
She allegedly filled a shopping cart with over $1,000 worth of merchandise and attempted to leave without paying.
Deputies confronted her in the parking lot, where she claimed she was playing a “game” called “21” involving stealing as much as possible without getting caught.
She first claimed to put the stolen items in a random car, then later admitted the vehicle was a rental linked to her boyfriend.
Deputies recovered the stolen merchandise from the vehicle, along with glass pipes, marijuana, methamphetamine, and other drugs.
A safe containing silver bars, copper bars, and a platinum bar was also found in the trunk.
McCann was arrested and charged with grand theft and multiple drug offenses.
The arrest was recorded on body camera and dashcam footage.
I am specifically requesting:

Body-worn camera footage from all deputies involved, including McCann’s initial detainment and questioning in the parking lot.
Footage of the search of the vehicle, including the discovery of stolen items and narcotics.
Dashcam footage capturing any additional statements made by McCann while inside the patrol car.
Any other publicly releasable footage related to the incident.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: USS Liberty: Copy of DoD Mandated Investigation of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am a survivor of the June 8, 1967 Israeli attack on the USS Liberty and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association. [https://ussliberty.org]

On June 8, 2005 the USS Liberty Veterans Association submitted “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967” to the Secretary of the Army in his capacity as Executive Agent for the Secretary of Defense. 

A copy of that report is at https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25497919-war-crimes-report-with-exhibits/.

The Department of Defense Law of War Manual requires “DoD policy has required that the commander of any unit that obtains information about a reportable incident shall immediately report the incident through the applicable operational command and Military Department.” [Paragraph 18.13.2, DoD Law of War Manual Page 1100]

The footnote on page 1100 states in part, “All reportable incidents committed by or against U.S. personnel, enemy persons, or any other individual are reported promptly, investigated thoroughly, and, where appropriate, remedied by corrective action.”

The DoD Law of War Manual is at https://dod.defense.gov/Portals/1/Documents/pubs/DoD%20Law%20of%20War%20Manual%20-%20June%202015%20Updated%20Dec%202016.pdf.

An excerpt of the relevant passage in the Law of War Manual is attached.

A reportable incident committed against U.S. personnel was reported to the Flag and other high-ranking US Navy officers serving on the US Navy Court of Inquiry when USS Liberty survivor Lloyd Painter testified under oath during the US Navy Court of Inquiry that he witnessed the IDF torpedo boats deliberately machine gunning of life rafts we had dropped over the side in anticipation of abandoning ship.

Upon receiving a copy of the US Navy Court of Inquiry Report, Painter noted that the portion of his testimony referenced above does not appear in the Report of the Court.

In his sworn deposition, Painter writes:

“1515 Hours: I climbed the ladder and opened the hatch to the main deck. I wanted to see if it was safe enough to bring the wounded sailors out onto the main deck. What I saw sent ice running through my veins. The life rafts were either destroyed or had been cut loose and had floated away. I personally observed an Israeli MTB methodically machine gun one of the Liberty's empty life rafts that had been cut loose and was floating in the water. I knew at that split second that the thrust of the IDF attack was to kill every American sailor on board. There were to be no survivors that day. I decided to leave all of the wounded sailors below decks for some measure of protection. I did not prepare to abandon ship.”

We have attached a complete copy of Lloyd Painter’s sworn deposition to this request.

We are requesting a copy of the investigation of the War Crimes investigation that is mandated by the Department of Defense Manual.

We are further requesting a copy of all records related to or mentioning our submission of “A Report: War Crimes Committed Against U.S. Military Personnel, June 8, 1967”

WE ARE NOT ASKING FOR ANOTHER COPY OF A US NAVY COURT OF INQUIRY REPORT BUT FOR THE REPORT OF THE MANDATED INVESTIGATION, CONDUCTED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOD LAW OF WAR MANUAL, ESTABLISHED TO INVESTIGATE AND RESOLVE THE ALLEGATIONS CONTAINED IN OUR WAR CRIMES REPORT WHICH WE SUBMITTED TO THE DOD ON JUNE 8, 2005.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors
